intro: Kirilowia arabica, commonly known as the Arabian coffee tree, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that contain the seeds used for coffee production. It thrives in arid and semi-arid climates with well-drained soil. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
